results.content:
This is a great course covering everything from the basics to advanced topics!  

I definitely learned a lot and have been able to apply the learnings toward building complex Excel applications that are being used by large groups within our enterprise.

results.content: Courses content are awesome, purposeful and easy to digest. Dan brings a lot of positive energy which makes him really interactive and entertaining to listen to, which definitely helped a lot during the some of the challenging parts of the course. Dan might be the best instructor I have found here on Udemy yet. I would definitely recommend the course for a non-VBA user like me!

results.content: This is a perfect course, where you'll get a new pack of skills for a industry applications, for me this was a PERFECT COURSE, able to make dynamic reports, searching applications, wonderful course, BUT i really want to know what is the next step, the next course.

results.content: An excellent course with very practical and easy-to-follow explanations. Highly recommended.
results.content_html: An excellent course with very practical and easy-to-follow explanations. Highly recommended.

results.content: There is a lot of content in this course with detailed explanations on complex functions. Still, there was no discussion on any practical use of say a fortune 500 company using this in their business because they wouldn't do that. They would contract with say Oracle or IBM because their systems have expanded capacity as well as continuity built into that kind of investment. I am glad for the few things I have taken away to be useful, but still am not sure what I can do with the rest. Lastly, I need to mention the instructor is very good at explaining the concepts.

results.content:
Quite good. However he DOES give us exercises sometimes that I can't figure out, only to find out his solution contains things we have not gone over at all yet. That is very frustrating. Its happened multiple times, most notably with vlookup. We were just expected to have previous knowledge of this function I guess? But there were other ones too. 

It's not a bad course though, I'm learning a lot and I still recommend it

Edit: So I just finished the course.
Some more complaints I had were it would be nice to have more exercises later in the course. Especially the last Section, that's the best way to solidify the learnings he taught us. 
I also would have liked to know how to create or update charts with VBA, but I think if I searched for some online tutorials I probably wouldn't be too lost figuring it out.
Also I did almost the entire course with captions (no audio), they could be a bit better.. a lot of it didn't make any sense, a lot of times I was just guessing what he was saying.
Overall I feel like it was well worth the money for this course, I feel like I could actually go into work and design some interesting things. 
Glad I purchased the course, thanks for teaching me. Thumbs up

results.content: Top quality course. Although I did find the parts on ActiveX Controls and Userforms a bit long.

results.content: Generally good content but Dan needs to consider his Students more.  Of course some people will struggle to learn programming but this course would be a lot shorter - and better - if he did not assume his Students were at primary school and/or incredibly stupid.  For example, even at lesson 25 (or so) he still informs everyone to type a space after 'sub'.
results.content_html: Generally good content but Dan needs to consider his Students more. Of course some people will struggle to learn programming but this course would be a lot shorter - and better - if he did not assume his Students were at primary school and/or incredibly stupid. For example, even at lesson 25 (or so) he still informs everyone to type a space after 'sub'.
